intro: Desplatsia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with prominent red stamens, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Desplatsia is native to the Americas and is commonly found in wetlands and along riverbanks. It is also known for its ability to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
